column3: Switching from rand to insecure_rand _prevents_ duplicates? How big is this random output exactly?\n
No, replacing the rand with deterministic, non-random variables prevents\nduplicates.\n
Oh, so the line in the 40s is the key change here. What's the difference between rand and insecure_rand, that the rest of the change switches to?\n

@michagogo insecure_rand is under our full control, which means it's possible to replay tests that failed (even on a different platform with different libc), at least if we log the seed value. It also removes all platform dependent variability in random values used for testing.\n

Ah. Makes sense. Thanks! Just looked and realized that insecure_rand is
something that is actually defined by one of our own files. That added
include should have clued me in soonerâ€¦ (I'm assuming that rand is a
built-in RNG?)
